name: Casa Cinco Patios

reviews.text: I highly recommend Casa Cinco Patios and will stay there my next vist. The rooms and furnishings are lovely and refined with excellent bathrooms. The original art is spectacular. There is a common living room and kitchen with satellite TV and free internet telephony to the USA! Multiple patio levels offer privacy and the rooftop level with garden offers a spectacular views of the city. Food and staff are superb. There are steps so ask for the lower room if walking is a problem. Great spot!
reviews.title: Perfect Oasis...I could live here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have found Casa Cinco Patios on tripadvisor, while traveling from Guanajuato to San Miguel. The reviews sounded great, so we decided to take a chance and booked the Flores suite. We were received by Antonio when arrived around 10pm. He was friendly, cheerful and extremely hospitable. Antonio gave us the tour of the house, including the five patios. We immediately loved the house and were very happy with our choice. The view of the night city, full of lights, from one of the five patios was simply stunning. I wish we had a bottle of wine to relax on the patio and enjoy the night scenery.
reviews.title: Terrific place and a great value.

reviews.text: Our room was great! Very cosy, impeccably clean, with a spacious bathroom (with everyone one might need). I loved the comfy bed and we had the most restful night.
reviews.title: Great B&B, Affordable, clean and very friendly

reviews.text: In the morning, we had a large and delicious breakfast. You could ask for any-style breakfast, which is great. During breakfast, we had a lovely conversation with the owners and Lechia (the cook). They told us about San Miguel, neighboring towns, things to do and gave recommendations for good restaurants and places to shop. Antonio was also kind to take pictures of both of us on the patios at our request, as it was a sunny day and we wanted a memory of the San Miguel's skyline.
reviews.title: i wish i would have stayed here sooner

reviews.text: The Casa is located a few blocks from the main square, it took us about 10 minutes walking in a relaxing pace. The area is very safe and the house is located next to the house of a famous Mexican actor Cantinflas, which we found special.
reviews.title: Enjoy your cocktails while looking over San Miguel

reviews.text: This is a great option for people who prefer independent travel. It is in a wonderful location, around a 10 minute walk up the hill (it's steep - but a great workout), overlooking the town. There are beautiful patios, where you can relax with a glass of wine and soak up the stunning sunset. The rooms and overall design is well thought out and stylish (our room was more like a suite). Breakfast is modest, but tasty.
reviews.title: Good option for independent travellers

reviews.text: The atmosphere is more around renting a room in someone's home, rather than a hospitality experience. This may not suit all travellers - but if you are happy to fend for yourself, then it is perfect. The welcome/orientation could be better - especially if you are unfamiliar with the town. I had also asked for transport recommendations, which were never sent. We also experienced no hot water on the final morning and felt there was no-one around to assist us. The hosts are certainly very friendly - but they need to up their game (especially when compared to other B&B's in Mexico).
reviews.title: An amazing and comfortable stay at Casa Cinco Patios for an awesome price!

reviews.text: I had an amazing and comfortable stay at Casa Cinco Patios. The accomodations were very cozy and well appointed. The food was great. The location is unbeatable with views unlike any other I have seen in San Miguel de Allende. Sunsets were especially breathtaking, but any time night or day you could enjoy and relax via any of the five beautiful patios. My favorite was the very top one while watching the sunset, drinking my glass of wine, and listening to my favorite music. The rates are very reasonable. I really fealt at home. Antonio is a wonderful host. If you get a chance to go to San Miguel de Allende, don't miss out on Casa Cinco Patios.
reviews.title: Most exciting and memorable 3.5 weeks of my life!

reviews.text: I usually travel solo, It's just my style. I meet the most fascinating people all over. I have the freedom to go when and where as I please at my own leisure. It is important to me that I able to enjoy my stay in a manner in which I am accustomed to or better. I want to experience what the locals do on a regular basis, to truly see how life would be as if I actually lived there. After learning so much from friends and literature about San Miguel de Allende, my time had come to see what it was all about. My stay at Casa Cinco Patios allowed me all the amenities of the local flare I was hoping for. The location is perfect. It is set on the hill overlooking the city. I was within minutes walking distance to the enjoy all the city has to offer. It was easy to catch a taxi, both day and night, if ever I did not want to walk down or back up. But I most often chose to walk. I felt safe all the time. I couldn't wait to get back home at Casa Cinco Patios, and relax while watching the most amazing sunsets, which I must inform you, can only be appreciated from the hill looking over the city and mountains in the backdrop. I live in a spacious one bedroom condo in the French Quarter in New Orleans, with a plush courtyard I enjoy from my balcony. Casa Cinco Patios definitely made me feel like I had all could ever ask for and more. If ever you get a chance to go to San Miguel de Allende, make it worth you while and stay there. My original plans were to stay just 12 days, however, I extended my stay twice and stayed 3.5 weeks :) November 18th - December 13th. Say hi to Antonio. Don't miss a breakfast from Licha. And never miss the sunsets.
reviews.title: Excellent experience all around

reviews.text: Antonio is a great and laid back host. The rooms are tastefully decorated, interesting, and full of Mexican flare. The tiled kitchen is a treat and is just one of several cozy places to have breakfast. The breakfast options are tasty - albeit not extensive - and I would go with the house special huevos rancheros. The view is one of the real selling points and you'll find the sunsets from at least two of the patios to be truly excellent. The house is a 10 minute leisurely walk to the center of town. The walk back up is steep, but you have to pay for the views. Prices are reasonable for the level of service offered. Note that there are a few small playful dogs around the site.
reviews.title: A most wonderful visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casa Cinco patios is a great place to appreciate all that San Miguel offers. The staff is always sure to offer every assistance to your needs, make you feel like home and not in a cold Hotel. The house is comfort itself and the breakfasts are enough to sustain the longest shopping trip. The most remarkable experience of all is the view of the town and the opportunity to see the sunset while cozily ensconced on the upper patio. This is an amazing part of Mexico and defies all the stereotypes we have acquired. We highly recommend Casa Cinco Patios. Buen Viaje!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: This was my first trip to San Miguel and it was a wonderful experience - it even surpassed my expectations. San Miguel is an incredibly beautiful town - and it's an easy walk to the town center from the Casa de Cinco Patios. I've traveled a lot and it's rare to find such a jewel of a town - with such old world charm and great food too.
reviews.title: Very charming B&B in beautiful old San Miguel

reviews.text: I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. The Los Pajaros bedroom was very spacious - more like a suite really, with it's own living room area and patio too. The breakfasts were delicious. Convenient WiFi access everywhere. Charming decor throughout and everything was immaculately maintained. I particularly enjoyed all of the outdoor patios and gardens. I highly recommend the Casa de Cinco Patios for your next trip to San Miguel.
reviews.title: Great rooms - great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You get the best of two worlds at Casa Cinco Patios. Beautiful furnished rooms as a 5 star hotel with the informal hospitality of a great bed & breakfast. I have come here now several times and I leave wanting to stay longer. Full breakfast and free wifi is included. There are several patios to enjoy the evening sunset in privacy plus other central patios, where you can hang out and meet other guest and the owners.
reviews.title: A Terrific Find!!

reviews.text: It's an eay stroll down to the main square. And it's relatively affordable making it, in my opinion, the best quality b&b deal in San Miguel de Allende.
reviews.title: A delightful home with a delightful view overlooking a delightful place!

reviews.text: I LOVED cinco patios!. I liked it so much I can't wait to come back in the summer. The view from the patios is amazing. The decorations are so beautiful. You just have to go stay there to feel the expierance. When you go , make sure you ask Lecha to make her famous guevos rancheros with black beans. Yum!!. They were so good!. See you soon cinco patios!!!
reviews.title: I can't wait for the summer!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's all been said over and over. Fabulous views. Uniquely decorated, exceptionally clean, hospitable hosts, reliable and friendly "Licha" to watch over and feed us.
reviews.title: A Repeat Stay in our Future

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed the location as without it we would not have enjoyed the wonderful sunsets over the Parroquia plus it gave us an excuse to over indulge; if needed, taxis are indeed everywhere.
reviews.title: Relaxed Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We appreciated our room - Los Pajaros. It was very spacious with a nice bathroom, comfortable queen-size bed and extremely private. Lovely and cool on hot, hot days; just the right temperature at right.
reviews.title: What a treat!

reviews.text: Already planning a repeat trip with friends in 2012.
reviews.title: Amazing View

description: Casa Cinco Patios is a Casual Bed and Breakfast with Excelent service at great rates, located right in Downtown San Miguel de Allende (Centro Historico). The house is spacious, colorful, well manicured and very comfortable on four levels providing privacy for all persons. Total 3 Bedrooms. Free internet in all the house and full breakfast with different options. We have spectacular views of San Miguel specifically the downtown, Parroquia (Main Church), and the mountains and lakes surrounding San Miguel. Sunsets are fantastic. The patios have sitting and dining areas. The house is beautifully decorated with Mexican folk art collected over 20 years
